result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin H. Manecke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain and maintain fulltime employment and/or school.

Counseling

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

records.addlTxt:
Case called:1:35pm. INCLUDES 13CF889, 14CF729. Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty James Connell. Matter set for Mtn to Revoke ct 1 on 13CF889; SAR on cts 2, 3 & 4 on 13CF889 and Plea/Sentencing on 14CF729. State recites partial agreement.  Crt enters Judgment on ct 1 (vehicle operator fee/elude) 13CF889- crt grants. Crt proceeds with plea in 14CF729. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to Amend Criminal Complaint in 14CF729- crt grantsState moves to DRI ct 1 (substantial battery) 14CF729- crt grants. PLEA: NO CONTEST - amend ct 2 (misd bj); amend ct 3 (dc) 14CF729. Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  Arguments to SAR in 13CF889. Atty Connell makes statement. 
COURT ORDERS: 
14CF729 - SWH - 1 yr probation. CONDITIONS: Counseling; Absolute Sobriety - alcohol; Good faith effort to obtain and maintain fulltime employment and/or school; Court Costs; DNA Surcharge. 
COURT ORDERS: 13CF889- Ct 1 (vehicle operator/elude) - SWH - 3 yrs probation concurrent to other probation. CONDITIONS: Counseling; Absolute Sobriety- alcohol; Court Costs; DNA Surcharge; 6 months dl revocation, retroactive to admin suspension. Eligible to apply for expungement on ct 1 -13CF889. Crt informs & signs Ineligible Voting Form. 
Crt proceeds with SAR on 13CF889 cts 2, 3 & 4. COURT ORDERS: 13CF889- Cts 2, 3 & 4 - 100 days MCJ w/huber for work, school or treatment; 71 days credit; Court Costs. 
Atty Connell makes statement re: revocation on fleeing charge. Crt makes findings above. Adjourned: 1:55pm.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
and Demand for Discovery and Inspection

No Alcohol; Absolute Sobriety; No bars, taverns, liquor stores or beer tents.
  No contact with victim(s): A.D. - Non-Waivable
Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
